It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and its pods are elongated and woody.
